subject: Web3
title: The DAO Experiment Continues
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The DAO Experiment Continues.

hook.text: DAOs are less than a decade old. They're clumsy, controversial, and possibly the future of human organization.

buildup.text: They've funded constitutions, governed billions, and proven that internet strangers can coordinate at scale.

discovery.text: Every failure teaches something. Every governance disaster refines the model. The experiment improves with each cycle.

twist.text: The biggest DAOs are quietly handling more capital than some countries' budgets. The scale is already real.

climax.text: DAOs aren't perfect. But the idea that people can organize without centralized control is too powerful to abandon.

punchline.text: DAOs are messy, young, and imperfect. They're also unstoppable.

quiz.question: What has the DAO experiment demonstrated so far?
options: Internet strangers can coordinate and govern large-scale treasuries
